programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys bag themselves a custom drift car and a luxury antiques unit which may contain a First World War pilot pistol. Plus, Ton gets into trouble at a car sale.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les challenges Seth to a high-stakes sales competition, but later faces the most dangerous customer he has ever encountered.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Hordes of angry customers face hour-long queues, Les tries to work out whether a dealer is selling stolen goods, and a feud erupts between Seth and Andy.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike is tempted by a retro smoking toy he finds in New Hampshire and needs Frank's bargaining skills to ensure a good price.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The hunters head to the edge of their territories, as one team struggles to get back on track after suffering problems with a boat.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Trouble brews in the form of a sudden winter storm, and Adam calls for reinforcements when a truck flips over a bank in Alberta.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys haggle over top-secret wartime documents, while Corey tries to get a good price for a toy from the 1970s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawn shop owners value a Cold War era heat-seeking missile guidance system, deliberate over a Playboy bunny uniform, and check out a 1986 Buick Regal motor car.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: A year of Brexit, Trump and May: plenty for Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to get their teeth into. This compilation special rounds up the best - and worst - bits of 2016..

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedian and writer David Baddiel, former MP and Strictly Come Dancing 2016 star Ed Balls, stand-up and actress Jo Brand and ex-Pussycat Doll and Celebrity MasterChef 2015 winner Kimberly Wyatt join host Rob Brydon and captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Ivo Graham, Cariad Lloyd, John Robins and Katherine Ryan are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Brian has been captured and forced to perform in a sinister circus, run by the cheerily sadistic Feffenhoffer, played by guest star Steve Coogan.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Marlene discovers the farmhands concocting a virility potion for Rocky the bull, and manages to sneak a dose into Boycie's coffee. Make-up is found in Tyler's room, and his parents are relieved to be told he has a girlfriend - until it transpires she is also his teacher. John Challis, Sue Holderness and Jack Doolan star.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Victoria and Albert's Highland Fling
programme.desc: Tony Robinson visits the Cairngorms National Park to discover how Queen Victoria and Prince Albert helped shape Scottish traditions and imagery, such as tartan, bagpipes and caber-tossing. Starting in Pitlochry, he traverses the Killiecrankie Pass, where the Jacobites won the Battle of Killiecrankie, and ends his trek at Balmoral and the fantasy castle Albert built as his and Victoria's Highland escape.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Norman Conquest of Pembrokeshire
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to the south-west corner of Wales and one of Britain's finest coastal paths to find out why Pembrokeshire feels so English, even though it's more than 100 miles from the border. With its numerous castles and a fine cathedral, there are sure signs the Normans stamped their mark over the area. Tony's four-day walk traces the story of their conquest of the county, which he discovers was very different from the knockout victory at Hastings, involving a long, fiercely fought struggle.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Nazi Occupation - Channel Islands
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to Guernsey and Jersey to tell the story of the islands' surrender to the Nazis during the Second World War. In Guernsey, he hears of the first bombing raid that heralded the German troops' arrival and sees the spot where the first-ever British commando landed in secret, only to see the planned revenge raid fail spectacularly. A ferry then takes him on to Jersey, where he finds almost all of its beaches have a bunker or a machine gun post left over from the conflict.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Secrets of the Murder Bureau
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates a secret department of the Bulgarian government charged with carrying out assassinations in nine other countries during the Cold War.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The search for Josef Mengele, one of the most wanted Nazi war criminals, which was led by Holocaust survivor Simon Wiesenthal.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The Antiques Roadshow pays tribute to Her Majesty the Queen as she becomes Britain's longest-serving monarch.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Since their meteoric rise in the 19th Century, railways have been at the forefront of modern engineering. They've conquered dizzying altitudes, wilderness, seas and cities..

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A settlement in Argentina destroyed by floods, a town in the US that has been erased, and a Soviet dream-town that turned into a nuclear nightmare.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents an episode from RAF Coningsby, an operational air base in Lincolnshire, where she takes to the sky in a Dakota aircraft and examines some air force memorabilia including a teddy bear that was on board one of the Dambuster planes and designs for the Vulcan bomber. Items brought in to be valued include a painting by John Singer Sergeant, a crystal decanter and an officer's coat from the American Civil War.

programme.title: Ganges
programme.desc: Exploring the story of the river, following its course from the Himalayas to their foothills. The programme reveals its enormous influence on the day-to-day living of a continent, how it has shaped Indian culture and religion and why it attracts a vast array of wildlife including snow leopards, Asiatic brown bears and bearded vultures.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough uses advanced surveillance technology to observe the feeding habits of herbivores, including elephants forced to undertake epic migrations to ensure a steady diet of the plants they need to survive. He also considers the habits of the sloth, which takes a month to digest each meal, and reveals scientific research suggesting that grazing wildebeest do not follow the rains as originally thought, but detect trails of phosphorus in the grass.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Since their rise in the 19th century, railways have been at the forefront of modern engineering and transport, conquering dizzying altitudes, wilderness, seas and cities.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The Jewish group the Avengers who, as the Second World War was ending, hunted down persecutors known to have contributed to deaths during the Holocaust, including Wilhelm Stuckart.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The role played by engineering giant Vickers during the Second World War, including the development of the Spitfire and how the Royal Navy recovered from losing so many warships.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: The discovery of a wreck off the coast of Florida sends a team of underwater explorers on a mission to discover the identity of a ship that simply shouldn't exist.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Marlene allows Boycie to buy a maximum of six cows for the farm - and is less than impressed when Elgin, Jed and Bryan turn up with a herd of 300. The vet is called out when Rocky the bull fails to take any notice of the females, and Tyler prepares to sit a local private school's entrance exam. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie struggles to come to terms with the news that his prize bull is gay, and Marlene finds she is missing the noise of the city after suffering sleepless nights. Tyler is delighted to learn he has failed all but two of his GCSEs, thinking he will no longer be accepted at a private school - but his parents have other ideas. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Marlene discovers the farmhands concocting a virility potion for Rocky the bull, and manages to sneak a dose into Boycie's coffee. Make-up is found in Tyler's room, and his parents are relieved to be told he has a girlfriend - until it transpires she is also his teacher. John Challis, Sue Holderness and Jack Doolan star.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Capt Blackadder applies to join the Royal Flying Corps, seeing it as a great way of getting out of the trenches and into a classroom. Comedy, guest starring Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson, with Rowan Atkinson and Tony Robinson.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Capt Blackadder sees a chance to get some rest while hunting for a spy in the field hospital, and decides he is not going to let his holiday be cut short just because he has found an obvious suspect with a German accent. Comedy, guest starring Miranda Richardson, with Rowan Atkinson and Tony Robinson.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Capt Blackadder tries every trick in the book to escape the trenches before the big push, including pretending to be insane - but ends up going over the top with sidekicks Baldrick and George. Final episode of the comedy, guest starring Geoffrey Palmer, with Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature length episode. When a Cambridge farmer dies beneath the blades of a combine harvester, Sam believes the death to be a tragic accident until an anonymous tip-off indicates more sinister forces are at work. Investigating the motives of the victim's neighbour, a former soldier, Sam is able to produce few solid leads. However, when the informant is found dead, the intrepid pathologist uncovers an Army cover-up. Drama, starring Amanda Burton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sheelagh finally decides to accept Gabriel's marriage proposal, and Smithy patches up his friendship with Gina, who is feeling more amenable to his overtures now she's been given the cancer all-clear. Meanwhile, Roger agrees to investigate an assault on his estranged wife Sandra's new boyfriend Rick - whose reticence to discuss the incident is soon explained by the discovery that he's a crook.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The strain of bringing up a child begins to show on Nick, Carole doubts her abilities and a garage blaze leads to danger.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pauline is making Petes funeral arrangements which is stressing Arthur out! Richards gives Mandy and Adrian some bad news and Mark is not feeling well.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The officers carry out a series of exercises in evacuating casualties from a combat zone, which leaves them convinced they are about to be sent on active duty.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Emotions run high as the regiment is sent on a dangerous assignment to Bosnia, and Phillip's handling of a sensitive situation jeopardises his relationship with Captain Williams.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sheelagh finally decides to accept Gabriel's marriage proposal, and Smithy patches up his friendship with Gina, who is feeling more amenable to his overtures now she's been given the cancer all-clear. Meanwhile, Roger agrees to investigate an assault on his estranged wife Sandra's new boyfriend Rick - whose reticence to discuss the incident is soon explained by the discovery that he's a crook.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Abra tries to help a patient waiting for a transplant by offering to operate with an animal organ, despite the procedure being illegal, and asks Mickie to assist him in theatre. Elliot monitors Margaret's condition as she returns from her stem cell treatment in Singapore, believing her case mirrors that of his wife, Gina.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A demonstration turns violent when squatters are evicted from their homes, and Josh and Finlay are forced to enter the fray. Later, they respond to a stabbing incident which places their lives in further danger. Meanwhile, Mel and Penny play Cupid to a cantankerous old man and his worried neighbour. Hospital drama, starring Kwame Kwei-Armah and Ian Bleasdale.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Reg organises a half-centenary celebration of Sun Hill, attended by dignitaries including former DCS Charles Barnett. On a less happy note, Amanda Prosser's insensitive treatment of a bereaved father provokes a hostage crisis, and the real Gabriel Kent turns up out of the blue, spelling big trouble for the unscrupulous copper who has assumed his identity.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The Fowlers are determined not to rise to the Chapman's bait. Phil is late for Kathy's party and Mandy & Aidan are left out in the cold.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: It's Boxing day and Mandy and Aidan have to face the truth. Gita has some news for Sanjay and Phil is increasingly troubled about Nadia.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Carole is left in charge while Nick goes away to a conference, but things do not exactly go as smoothly as she would have hoped. Meanwhile, a new fire-fighter joins the team.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Tree surgeon Malcolm arrives to deal with the forest's blight problem - and Paul is dismayed to discover the newcomer is Iona's ex-fiance. Molly coaches Jess to compete in the ghillies' gruelling annual challenge, despite the fact the other competitors snub her efforts. Meanwhile, Ewan is envious when Amy starts spending a great deal of time with her art tutor. Highland drama, starring Lloyd Owen and Rae Hendrie.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Beth and Tom prepare to tie the knot, but reckon without a few last-minute hitches as Joe suddenly decides he can't be the best man and the bride worries over whether to invite her father. Meanwhile, Sally bites off more than she can chew, the green-eyed monster in Anna makes an appearance when Beth's cousin takes a shine to David and a multiple sclerosis sufferer requires assistance.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Darryl plots to spend a night with Tracey by escaping from hospital, while Sharon makes her own plans for the evening's entertainment. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie uncovers disturbing information regarding his ancestral line. Tyler's surprising return from university adds to his sense of worry, convincing him something serious is about to happen. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio scheme to get Wally out from under Nora Batty's thumb for a day, but come a cropper sneaking him back to the house. Comedy, starring Bill Owen and Joe Gladwin.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio stumble across a health farm on a day out, leading Foggy to devise an ingenious money-making scam - selling food to its famished inhabitants. Comedy, starring Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A schoolgirl's killing brings Gently into the alien world of pop and media celebrity when it turns out the victim's best friend is a rising TV star. Bacchus suspects the dead girl's music teacher, since rumours persist that she was having an affair with him. But when it seems everyone has a different opinion of the girl, Gently must uncover these different faces to get to the truth of her murder. Neil Morrissey guest stars alongside Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: While Brian spends time at home making peace with himself over his dismissal, he agrees to help Esther's friend Margaret find her missing brother Peter, in the interest of keeping his mind active. Peter was the accountant of a man who has gone to prison for the murder of his wife, so Brian visits the convict hoping he will be able to assist. However, his investigation begins to encroach on the Ucos team's efforts to track down a conman who may be connected to several outstanding cases. With Rosalind Ayres and Art Malik.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam is called to examine the bodies recovered from a fatal helicopter crash, and her findings soon threaten to rip through the heart of the community living around the airfield. Drama about a forensic pathologist, starring Amanda Burton.

programme.title: Harry's Heroes: The Full English
programme.sub-title: Harry's Heroes: Euro Having a Laugh
programme.desc: The second leg of the tour takes the boys to Italy, where they're holing up at a traditional Palazzo in Florence. Assistant Manager John Barnes thinks the lads need a bit of culture, so sends them off sightseeing to take in the Ponte Vecchio and Michelangelo's David. At training, fitness coach Luke Worthington puts the boys through their paces, but it's not looking good as the team is carrying so many injuries there are only three fit players. Plus, they've lost one of their biggest characters - Neil 'Razor' Ruddock - who had to leave the tour in Paris to return to London for tests on his heart.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: Guest chef Rosemary Shrager tests the contestants' knife skills with a potato-slicing round. Six surviving players go through to the next stage where they have to butterfly a whole rainbow trout, before the final three attempt to impress her with their finished fish dish. Fern Britton hosts.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring celebrity interviews.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis which sees a team of five friends from Southampton compete to answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Long-running drama with the residents of England's most famous cobbled street.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: Manchester-born brothers Ryan, Adam and Scott Thomas embark on an epic journey to trace their family roots in India, joined by their dad Dougie, whose father was born in Mumbai. However, the trio have never visited the country they descended from. In the fourth episode, the three brothers track down another branch of their growing family tree, before being put through their paces in a brutal yoga session. Later, they travel to a place renowned for its spiritual enlightenment, but a therapeutic conversation takes a decidedly different turn as the brothers finally get to have their say and talk to Dougie about how they felt when he left the family home when they were children.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: The comedian follows the work of Battersea Dogs & Cats Home in London, meeting staff involved in treating, training and rehoming animals. This time, Paul meets a 10-month-old puppy who has been brought into Battersea twice for being too boisterous, before helping to soothe a pointer cross who has had a hard life.

programme.title: Harry's Heroes: The Full English
programme.sub-title: Harry's Heroes: Euro Having a Laugh
programme.desc: In the final episode, Harry, John and the team embark on the final leg of the tour in Germany, as they prepare to face their arch-rivals at the Wacker Arena in Burghausen. After checking into their Hotel in the Bavarian Alps, Harry receives the German team sheet, leaving him concerned his team are going to have to massively step up their game. With the fear of the match going to penalties hanging over their head, Harry brings in a German psychologist to offer some advice. Finally the big day arrives, and Harry has managed to recruit Manchester United legend Teddy Sheringham, so the team finally has its missing striker.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: Harry's Heroes: The Full English
programme.sub-title: Harry's Heroes: Euro Having a Laugh
programme.desc: In the final episode, Harry, John and the team embark on the final leg of the tour in Germany, as they prepare to face their arch-rivals at the Wacker Arena in Burghausen. After checking into their Hotel in the Bavarian Alps, Harry receives the German team sheet, leaving him concerned his team are going to have to massively step up their game. With the fear of the match going to penalties hanging over their head, Harry brings in a German psychologist to offer some advice. Finally the big day arrives, and Harry has managed to recruit Manchester United legend Teddy Sheringham, so the team finally has its missing striker.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to France to buy a bargain Citroen, but back in the workshop Edd China finds chronic problems with its self-levelling suspension.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce is doing up a wartime German tank engine so that he can pay for Glenn Miller's army uniform, a special Second World War relic.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Sr is upset not to hear from Paul Jr or Mikey as he deals with his mother's death, while OCC unveils a gold bike for Donald Trump and PJD begins a build for One Call Concepts.

programme.title: Aircraft Stories
programme.desc: America's obsession with air superiority and the obstacles faced by the designers of advanced fighter aeroplanes.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe visits an operation to clean up a hazardous oil spill in Alaska, before helping to pull a car from a frozen lake in Minnesota.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes of the Lamborghini Aventador.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: How the Jaguar F-Type is produced.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How deliveries are made to the International Space Station, and the processes used to make the world's most expensive and luxurious beds.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon Lovegrove are off to the West Country and Oxfordshire in search of vintage treasure to buy, restore and flog. Their discoveries include rare motoring memorabilia, 1970's kitsch and a fabulous collection of stationary engines.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon Lovegrove search a Cornish surf shack, where they find a bevy of custom bikes, surf buggies and all kinds of weird and wonderful objects. Is there a nice little earner lurking in Cornwall?.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The captain of the Seabrooke fights an agonising illness and the Northwestern takes revenge on the Time Bandit as the Bering Sea fleet finishes the season.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie Justin's second-hand excavator develops an expensive oil leak. Col's crew are a man down and the Fire Crew are on a wild goose-chase hunting a bounty of fabled fire opal.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Blackpool, an old pub is pulled down, and in Portsmouth the boat breakers break up an unused and unloved yacht. Plus, a house is cleared of its treasures.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds an unregistered Cobra sports car that has only 1,000 miles on its clock, but expert mechanic Edd China faces a difficult challenge to get it to pass a tough emissions test.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Bill Warner of the Amelia Island Concours asks Wayne to present his Davis three-Wheeler at a show, but his schedule only permits eight weeks to restore the car.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini makes a costly mistake when he decides to put up for auction a classic '64 Cobra without a reserve price.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: An insight into how wind turbines with twice the wingspan of a Boeing are made. Plus, how the ooze of a tree is moulded into car tyres.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The design and manufacture of tank-piercing 'super bullets', and the creation of dentists' drills.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie Justin's second-hand excavator develops an expensive oil leak. Col's crew are a man down and the Fire Crew are on a wild goose-chase hunting a bounty of fabled fire opal.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The captains are left reeling when their crab quotas are slashed, and must decide whether to keep fishing the depleted grounds or search for elusive blue crabs.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton travels the world to view vehicles and memorabilia worth buying and restoring. In the first edition, the larger-than-life Londoner gets his hands on a 70-year-old Volkswagen Schwimmwagen - an amphibious car that he test-drives through a lake at a country fare.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to Devon, where he finds a wealth of unusual oddities housed in a country pub. He moves on to Hastings, East Sussex, which has enjoyed a recent resurgence in the antiques trade.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Blackpool, a 1930s church is ready to be buried. Meanwhile, in Sussex the team attempts to resurrect a vintage limousine from the 1980s into a banger racer.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to France to buy a bargain Citroen, but back in the workshop Edd China finds chronic problems with its self-levelling suspension.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The rookies suffer tension as a new partner leads them on a wild goose chase underground. Meanwhile, the Cooke Brothers' season gets off to a bad and dangerous start.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a sign-writer's business in Portsmouth, where he finds one of his favourite objects. Later, in Southend-on-Sea, Essex, Drew is given a chance to indulge his inner petrol-head as he meets Porsche restorers.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he has encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In Nashville, Danielle introduces Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz to a former Chevy dealership that could provide an awesome new home base.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The supply of vanilla to make the world's favourite ice-cream flavour. Plus, how as many as 12 million cigarette lighters are made each year, and a look at the production of anchors for ships.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how footballs are crafted, how mussels are farmed, and how to design the ultimate fighter pilot's helmet.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sets out to buy a Rolls-Royce but takes a chance when offered a 1984 Bentley Mulsanne Turbo, much to the dismay of Edd China when he sees the paintwork.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Cases in which partners teamed up to commit murder, including execution-style killings by two taxi drivers in New Jersey. Plus, an insight into a new DNA identification technique.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Dalene Carlson. When she vanished one evening in August 2011, CCTV footage revealed several suspects, each with a motive. Jason Gilley later stood trial for kidnap, rape and murder.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: Documentary recalling how in December 2001, Michael Augustson arrived home to a scene of unspeakable horror following the fatal stabbing of his wife Melisa. The pair had only recently moved to Alma, Georgia, where they had soon been accepted by the small-town community.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Investigators discover a woman was stalked and murdered for her casino winnings when her decomposed body is found a month after her abduction.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The animal protection officers pull out all the stops to help three neglected horses that have become so desperately hungry, even sand is food.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Lewis tries to solve a mysterious condition on a dog. Plus, at Perth Zoo Dr Peter looks after an elephant and Dr Danni helps a dog with a suspected twisted stomach.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Krystle shares the spotlight with her mother, Afrodite argues with her mum over fashion and Lindsey wants hers to attend the fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: The Big Day
programme.desc: Patti-Anne is planning her wedding in the Bahamas, where she wants to look like a mermaid, but her worst nightmare comes true when the wrong dress arrives.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown heads to Abu Dhabi after a special invitation to visit an extraordinary veterinary hospital, where sick and injured falcons are treated like royalty.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown gets a terrible delivery when a kitten with shocking injuries turns up in a cardboard box, and Tim Faulkner struggles to remove a diamond python from a drain.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Examining the work of animal police in the city of San Francisco. Scott rescues a dehydrated pit bull puppy that was left muzzled and chained in the back of a hot car.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Lieutenant Scott uncovers an illegal cache of constrictor snakes, raising concerns that the deadly predators are being traded, and an abused dog fights for its life.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The investigation into the murders of two men found beaten to death in a bar. An anonymous letter to a TV station provides a vital lead for detectives involved in the case.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 19-year-old Katelin Akens, who vanished in a Virginia shopping mall, while en route to the airport to fly home to her fiancee.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Danielle Imbo and Richard Petrone, who vanished after leaving a night club on Philadelphia's South Street in February 2005. No evidence of their fate has emerged in the years since, and nor has there been any sight of Petrone's missing vehicle.

programme.title: Reasonable Doubt
programme.desc: The case of Penny Brummer, who was accused of murdering her ex-girlfriend's best friend. She had been so drunk at the time, it proved difficult to establish her innocence.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Justyna searches for a dress with just hours until her wedding, Shauna seems like she would rather be somewhere else and Sherry brings along her fiance.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A change of venue leaves Amy wanting to replace her wedding dress, while Tara seeks an outfit that accentuates her figure and Lisa has her eye on a $4,000 gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Lindsay looks forward to a fresh start after enduring many personal tragedies, while Cher brings along her new family to help find the perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The grooms take over the salon and the consultants know that when 'the man' is in the salon, he is the one who could be driving the appointment. All of which guarantees them an interesting shift.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Davone arrives with high expectations, former cheerleader Carrie seeks the right dress, having returned a previous purchase, and military bride Jennifer has her first fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Christy wants a dress that will cover a scar and brings along her twin brothers to help choose, while Cathy arrives with her best men.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three rivals with a passion for all things vintage battle it out at a market in the ancient village of Valbonne on the Cote d'Azur. Back in the UK, the trio head to Oxford to sell it all, with whoever makes the most profit winning everyone's cash. Jake creates a new table top out of a pallet, Elaine goes all out with a peacock chair, while Zoe's gluing efforts leave her unstuck.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Prestige Pawnbrokers boss James Constantinou has his work cut out sealing a deal with a pushy young entrepreneur who wants to borrow £100,000 against his Lamborghini, while there's a shock in store for film director Ken Russell's ex-wife Hetty when she brings in a collection of family photographs. A married couple become emotional as they look to pawn a large painting, a mum-of-three parts with her mother's diamond ring to support her kids, and long-term client Tauren risks losing his prized set of designer watches by falling behind on his loan repayments.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Weighing over 700lbs, Nicole is on the verge of leaving her children motherless. She commits to the diet programme, but a crisis threatens to derail all her hopes.

programme.title: Dan's 80lb Testicle
programme.desc: Documentary introducing Dan Maurer, whose life was derailed seven years earlier by a condition known as scrotal lymphedema, which caused his scrotum to start growing uncontrollably.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: In India, Arpit was born with his heart positioned on the outside of his rib cage, and in Brazil, Winny suffers from a rare disorder that means her skin falls off.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: A case in which a teenage couple disappeared from a Colorado neighbourhood in the middle of winter. Their car turned up abandoned and burnt in a field. The spring thaw revealed a hideous truth that shocked the community.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How convictions were secured in three murder cases through the gathering of trace evidence, including luminol blood testing and fingerprinting.
